repnme.cdata!:
Zambia - Economic Recovery and Investment
            Promotion Technical Assistance Credit

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Economic Recovery
            and Investment Promotion Technical Assistance Credit for
            Zambia was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: Baseline indicator data should be
            gathered and target sets at the beginning of the project to
            assist in successful implementation. The lack of
            transparency in this transaction was an important reason for
            the public's loss of support and the reason that even
            now, privatization as an integral part of the economic
            strategy has not taken root. The inclusion of the
            privatization of utilities in the project goals was
            overambitious in its assessment of government commitment as
            well as the amount of time required to privatize utilities.
            The complexity and political sensitivity of such programs
            require a comprehensive program that builds capacity of the
            ministry, regulatory agency as well as opening the sector to
            private sector participation. Privatization is a sensitive
            reform; it can affect jobs, national pride and vested
            interests. Comprehensive employee information, counseling
            and retraining programs should be integral to privatization
            projects to ease the burden on the retrenchees and soften
            the negative effects on public opinion and government
            commitment to privatization. There was a high turnover of
            project managers during the second half of the project, a
            not uncommon situation made worse due to the lack of
            documentation slowing down the transition between managers.

repnme.cdata!:
Zambia - Economic Recovery and Investment
            Promotion Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Economic Recovery
            and Investment Promotion Technical Assistance Credit Project
            is to support the implementation of the Economic Recovery
            and Investment Promotion Reform Program and to continue the
            implementation of reforms that were the focus of previous
            adjustment operations, namely the privatization of
            parastatals and the reform of the legal framework governing
            business activity. The project aims to provide technical
            assistance and other support to the government of Zambia to
            implement policy, institutional and regulatory reforms that
            will support the economic reform program. The project will
            finance the following components: 1) investment-banking,
            legal and other specialist advisory services to the
            government of Zambia to assist in the preparation and
            implementation of the Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines Ltd.
            privatization plan; 2) further assistance to the Zambia
            Privatization Agency to finance the services of consultants
            and specialists to prepare about 30 public enterprises for
            sale; 3) technical assistance and training to strengthen the
            Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development to oversee the
            implementation of the new Mining Act by improving its
            geological database, its ability to promote the sector to
            private investors, and its capability to administer and
            supervise the mining sector, including the small-scale
            miners; and 4) technical assistance to the Department of
            Legal Drafting under the Ministry of Legal Affairs to
            strengthen its capacity to prepare new business legislation
            to support the economic reform program.
